title: Updated mio dependency to 0.8
body: Fixes #131

title: Removed peer_addr() call used only for logging purposes
body: Sometimes the peer_addr() recovered is set as not connected. Because this method is called only for logging purpose, it can safety removed to avoid connection issues

title: Added cancel timers
body: Allow cancel timer events previouslly sent

title: websocket without tls
body: `websocket` feature should enable only websocket without tls

title: Websocket depends on tcp feature
body: Related to https://github.com/lemunozm/message-io/issues/98

title: fix typo and remove unnecessary args
Send updates
body:
- Modified `SendStatus::MaxPacketSizeExceeded`, now it not contains lengths info.
- Renamed `udp::MAX_COMPATIBLE_PAYLOAD_LEN` to `udp::MAX_LOCAL_PAYLOAD_LEN`, value updatedwith `udp::MAX_PAYLOAD_LEN`.
- Removed `udp::MAX_PAYLOAD_LEN`.- Added `udp::MAX_NETWORK_PAYLOAD_LEN`.

title: non-blocking connection
body:
closes https://github.com/lemunozm/message-io/issues/79

- Asynchronous connections: `NetworkController::connect()` behaviour modified.
Now it performs a non-blocking connection.
- Reduced slightly the websocket latency.
- Adapter API modified to handle easily handshakes.
- Fixed websocket issue that could offer an accepted websocket that was not valid (the websocket handshake could have failed).
- Added `NetworkController::is_ready()`
- Added `SendStatus::ResourceNotAvailable`

title: Fix Endpoint::from_listener checks and added tests
Enabled public endpoint construction. Added example with listeners
body: - The user can create its own Endpoint with listeners from non-connection oriented transport protocols

title: Reduced NodeHandler clone cost
body: Although the `NodeHandler` was already clonable. It underlying contained three Arcs. Because the NodeHandler is an entity that in practice can be copied hundred or thousands of times this Arcs quantity has been reduced to one to save more memory and be faster in the clones

title: Reduced dependencies
body:
Reduced some compilation dependencies (around 10-20 less external dependencies depending on the features):
- `url`: Now, only compiled when the `websocket` feature is enabled. 
- Changed `crossbeam` to `crossbeam_channel`: The `crossbeam` was adding the entire suite of crossbeam libraries when only the channel was used. There is a PR https://github.com/lemunozm/message-io/pull/21 doing the opposite, but it seems that targeting the channel part of the `crossbeam` is correct.

title: Added NodeListener::enqueue
body:
This PR adds a function to handle the library similar to version 0.11. It adds a non-closure synchronized way (based on an event queue) to process the events.

Nevertheless, this easy comes with an increase in latency. In order to get the best performance, is better to use the `for_each` functions.

- Added `NodeListener::enqueue()`

title: Minor grammatical fixes
body: Like the project a lot but not *quite* well-versed enough in rust yet to help with the low-level stuff; figured I'd try and help with something though :)

title: Split for_each in sync and async modes
body:
Minor API change:
- Updated `NodeListener::for_each` to works fully synchronous. `Send` trait of the event callback parameter has been removed to works fine with objects like `Rc` `Cell` or references. This method no longer returns a `NodeTask`.
- New method `NodeListener::for_each_async` has been added to support the previous behavior of
`for_each`.
- Added `Debug` to `NodeEvent`.

title: Reduced websocket latency
body:
Internal improvement to reduce the WebSocket latency while reading messages.
- The improvement affects all users except windows.
- Reduce the latency by around 40%.

Related issue: https://github.com/snapview/tungstenite-rs/issues/195

title: Fixed sending UDP and WS sending methods for packet limits
body:
- *WebSocket* now can returns when send correctly a `SendStatus::MaxPacketSizeExceeded` instead of `ResourceNotFound` if the packet size is exceeded.
- *UDP* has increases the packet size when send.
  Now more bytes per packet can be sent if the OS let it.
- Exported some adapter constants dependent.
- `Transport::max_message_size()` now represents the teorical maximum size (see its related docs).

title: Node API: Zero-copy message
body:
closes: https://github.com/lemunozm/message-io/issues/61

List of API changes:
- Node concept: `NodeHandler` and `NodeListener`.
- Non-mutable and shared network operations.
- Removed AdapterEvent. Now, the only network event is NetEvent that has been modified to contains a reference to the data instead of an allocated vector.
- Removed `Network` entity that has been substituted by `NetworkController` to handle connect/listen/remove/send and `NetworkProcessor` to handle the input events.
- Remamed `EventQueue`to `EventReceiver`.
- Minor API additions.
- Now UDP never generates disconnection events.
- Increased performance:
  - Latency reduced in arround 66%.
  - Zero-copy message.

title: Internal reorganization
body:
From: https://github.com/lemunozm/message-io/issues/61
- RunnableThread entity to manages runnable/stoppable threads easily, into `util/thread.rs`
- Cargo test in README example: thanks to awesome and simple lib `doc-comment`
- `encoding` module into `util` module.
- Unified network module.

title: Internal refactors
body:
Some internal refactorizations and improvements in order to prepare `message-io to achieve this: https://github.com/lemunozm/message-io/issues/61

- Shareable network among thread (the API remains mutable until the API change).
- Minor integration tests improvements.
- Prepare Poll to work with wakers.
- Prepare Network to perform user network actions in its own callback.

title: Use integer_encoding crate for varint encoding in tcp header
body: closes #60

title: RemoteAddr extensions
body:
Associated to feature: https://github.com/lemunozm/message-io/issues/55
- Implemented `Serialize`/`Deserialize` for `Transport`.
- Implemented `Serialize`/`Deserialize` for `RemoteAddr`.
- Changed `Url` to `String` in `RemoteAddr`.
- Increase the `ToRemoteAddr` support for many types.

title: Modified Connection/Added events with listener info
body:
- Added `RegisterId` of the listener which generates the connection in `AdapterEvent::Added`
and `NetEvent::Connection` events.

title: Network::remove() returns bool
body:
Change returning value of `Network::remove()` from `<Option<()>` to `bool`.

**Rationale:** Removing a connected connection could return `None` in the previous version of `remove` if just a disconnection happens. The user probably will use `.unwrap()` on it adding a potential bug. Changing from `Option<()>` to `bool` avoid this usage.

title: Prepare release 0.10.2
body: - Added `try_receive()`

title: Added x32 cross compile ci job
body: Providing CI for x32 cross-compilation: https://github.com/lemunozm/message-io/issues/41

title: Tests features
body: - Enable running test/benchmarks feature based

title: Add try_recv() for non-blocking event queue reads
body:
Discussed in https://github.com/lemunozm/message-io/issues/46.

I tried to run rustfmt but ran into some issues with the .rustfmt.toml file. Probably a better idea to wait until that is fixed before merging this.

I also wrote some unit tests to cover some of the common use cases. Would appreciate some extra 👀 on it to make sure I've done it correctly. I'm sure there's a more elegant way of doing this but seems to serve as a solid foundation. Either way, feedback/comments appreciated!

**Discussion points:**
* Should this be named try_recv or try_receive?
* Does the comment look OK?
* I really wanted to avoid copying the instant but was running into multiple mutable borrow issues for self.timers

title: Transport by feature
body:
This PR allows activating the different transports by feature.

- Facilitates cross-compilation issues (https://github.com/lemunozm/message-io/issues/41)

title: Reverted breaked ci and fixed x32 issue
Framed tcp. Release 0.10
body:
- `Transport::Tcp` renamed to `Transport::FramedTcp` (because it is framed!)
- Added a new transport `Transport::Tcp` that acts as a real Tcp.
- Renamed `Transport::max_payload()` to `Transport::max_message_size()`.
- Added `Endpoint` into `AdapterEvent`.
- Fixed `ResourceId` compilation in 32-bits. (https://github.com/lemunozm/message-io/issues/41)
- Reverted inner tuple position of `Network::split()` as it has in version 0.8. First `Network`, then `EventQueue`, as a user would expect.

title: Fixed ResourceId for 32bits arch
body:
From: https://github.com/lemunozm/message-io/issues/41

It was not as simple as modifying the `usize` to u64 because `mio` uses an `usize` internally too and the value is clamped by the 32-bits OS poll.

The fix encodes the adapter id and resource type information into the less significant bits instead of the most significant bits to be sure that whatever word size is used in the OS, these values are always encoded into the `ResourceId`.

title: Added split_and_map_from_adapter method to the Network.
Fixed issues. Release 0.9.1
body:
- Fixed UDP sending issue (see changelog)
- Fixed TCP encoding issue.
- Fixed WebSocket accept issue.
- Fixed integration test.
- Organized performance tests (not stable yet).
- Added a *burst* test with order check

title: Removed serialization. Release 0.9
body:
**Rationale:** The serialization inside `message-io` was merely a shortcut and in most cases, it reduces the power of the user by saving 2-3 lines of their code. The serialization should be handle by the user for several reasons:
  - The user could want to decide to send the message base on the serialized data size.
      (e.g. choosing a different transport if the serialized size exceeds the max packet size)
  - The user could want to perform some action over raw data.
  - The user could make a gateway without needed to deserialize to serialize again.
  - The user could want specific serializing methods.
  - The user could mix several kinds of serializations.
  - Or simply, there is no need to serialize in some cases.


Also it PR brings other minor changes:
 - Disabled bench tests until https://github.com/lemunozm/message-io/pull/34
 - Renamed `remove_resource` by `remove`
 - Exposed `AdapterEvent`
 - Added `Network::split_and_map()`.
 - Added Transport::max_payload().
 - Exposed `encoding` module.
 - Fixed message_size test for big messages.

title: Proteced ws accept, fixed ping-pong example.
body:
- Fixed `ping-pong` example to work fina in all protocols.
- Protected ws listener for malicious TCP connections.
- Release 0.8.1

title: Protected against EventQueue dropped before its senders.
Returned local_addr at connect. Prepare release 0.8
body: - connect() returns also local_addr

title: Improved error handling in integration tests
Simpler adapters
body:
- Simpler way to make adapters.
- Fixed multicast dropped successfully.
- Fixed some memory leaks at decoding.
- Refactored tests.
- Minor renames.

title: Fixed UDP packet size
body: - Increase the UDP packet size from `1472` to `9188`  (the minimum OS MTU: OSX)

title: Network engine refactorization
body:
This PR brings a more clean and generalized way to make new adapters based in `mio`.
- It offers a new layer, the network engine, as a brick to the new adapters.
- Also, it merges all threads from all adapter into one only thread.
- Creates trait definitions for implementing easily new adapters.

title: WIP: websocket adapter
body:
Related issue: https://github.com/lemunozm/message-io/issues/11

Adapter for WebSocket using `tungstenite`

title: Multiple adapters
body:
This PR refactors the internals to prepare message-io to add easily new transport protocols to `message-io`.

Also brings some fixes, API changes, and performance improvements, (see the `CHANGELOG.md`)

title: Switch crossbeam_channel(deprecated) to crossbeam
body:
Hello @lemunozm ~
As discussed in #20 , I've bump-up 'crossbeam_channel' to `crossbeam`.

Test has been passed, but please let me know if you think it needs more test cases.

title: Fixed decoded issue with messages less than Padding size
body: Fixed issue https://github.com/lemunozm/message-io/issues/2

title: Fixed leak memory. Better timer events
body:
- Fixed a leak memory produced in each timer sending
- The internals of timers uses now the `at` method from `crossbeam-channel 0.5`

title: Network renaming
body: - Minor API naming refactors

title: Performance tests
body: - Added several performance tests

title: Fixed data lost on Non-Blocking send & protected UDP.
body:
- Fixed non-blocking data lost by active waiting.
- Protected from long UDP packets. 
- Added integration tests.
- Updated v0.4.6

title: Error handling
body:
Features:
- Now a Disconnection event is generated if the Endpoint sending a reset.
- New Event: DeserializationError, that will be sent in case of an error at message deserialization.
- Better internal error messages.
